creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Shaped panel of dull orange k'ossu.  At the top a gourd of gold surrounded by bats and peaches.  At the bottom the sacred gong.  Colors include blue, green, pink, red, and green.  Along the shaped top and across the bottom, a band of blue k'ossu with a design of lotus blossoms and stylized bronze-style dragon forms.  Border of green satin brocade with a diaper of four-petaled blossom enclosing a swastika and longevity symbols in blue and brick red.  Lining of figured raw silk K'ossu worn loose in upper section.  Inscription.
title: Panel
